repo_summary: The original ABC programming language (CWI) by Guido van Rossum and others.
strengths: Historical significance as Python's most direct predecessor
Well-documented with references to original papers and books
Includes a script for converting K&R-style function definitions to ANSI prototypes
weaknesses: Assumes a 32-bit system and needs to be upgraded for 64-bit systems
Lack of a clear license (MIT license hoped for)
Some files have outdated modification times
suggested_improvements: Upgrade source code to work on 64-bit systems
Compare and unify with another copy of the ABC sources
notes: This repository is a historical artifact and a valuable resource for understanding the origins of Python.
